author: mklement0
body:
`Get-Command` finds commands whether or not their defining module is currently loaded. (It implicitly loads the defining module, assuming it is in one of the folders listed in `$env:PSMODULEPATH`).

`Get-Alias`, by contrast, only finds aliases defined by currently loaded modules, which is unexpected.

Note that _invoking_ an alias defined in a module in a standard location that isn't currently imported works fine. 

Note: The above assumes that preference variable `$PSModuleAutoloadingPreference` is at its default, `All`. If `Get-Alias` is enhanced, it should respect this preference variable, just as `Get-Command` does.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
# Create module 'SampleModule' that exports alias 'Foo', aliased to `Get-Date`,
# in the current user's module location.
$psm = & { param($name, $content) New-Item -Force -Type File "$(($env:PSMODULEPATH -split [System.IO.Path]::PathSeparator)[0])/$name/$name.psm1" -Value $content } SampleModule "New-Alias Foo Get-Date`nExport-ModuleMember -Alias Foo"

# !! Since the module isn't loaded yet, this fails.
Get-Alias Foo

# Get-Command implicitly loads the module and returns information about the alias.
Get-Command Foo

# Now that the module is loaded, this succeeds.
Get-Alias Foo

# Remove the module.
Remove-Item (Split-Path $psm) -Recurse
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```
CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source                                                                                               
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------                                                                                               
Alias           Foo -> Get-Date                                    0.0        SampleModule                                                                                         
Alias           Foo -> Get-Date                                    0.0        SampleModule                                                                                         
Alias           Foo -> Get-Date                                    0.0        SampleModule                                                                                         
```


Actual behavior
---------------

```
Get-Alias : This command cannot find a matching alias because an alias with the name 'Foo' does not exist.
At /Users/mklement/Desktop/pg/pg1.ps1:15 char:1
+ Get-Alias Foo
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (Foo:String) [Get-Alias], ItemNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : ItemNotFoundException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetAliasCommand
 
CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source                                                                                               
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------                                                                                               
Alias           Foo -> Get-Date                                    0.0        SampleModule                                                                                         
Alias           Foo -> Get-Date                                    0.0        SampleModule                                                                                         
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PowerShell Core v6.0.0-alpha (v6.0.0-alpha.17) on Darwin Kernel Version 16.4.0: Thu Dec 22 22:53:21 PST 2016; root:xnu-3789.41.3~3/RELEASE_X86_64
```
title: Get-Alias doesn't find aliases defined in available but not currently loaded modules
